meta.title: Helvetra - The very Swiss translation app
meta.description: A simple, private translation app built in Switzerland. Swiss German, French, German, Italian, English. Your words stay in Switzerland.

hero.subtitle: Simple, private, precise. Built in Switzerland for everyone who values their words.

apertus.title: Powered by Apertus
apertus.text: Swiss AI developed by ETHZ and EPFL. Research excellence from Switzerland's top universities.

infomaniak.title: Hosted by Infomaniak
infomaniak.text: 100% Swiss infrastructure. Your data stays in Swiss data centers, protected by Swiss privacy laws.

swiss.title: Developed in Switzerland
swiss.text: Built with care in Bern. Swiss engineering for a tool you can trust.

focus.title: Focus
focus.text: One purpose, done well. No chat history, no distractions. Just translation.

simplicity.title: Simplicity
simplicity.text: Type, translate, done. The interface gets out of your way.

privacy.title: Privacy
privacy.text: Your translations are yours. No training on your data. No tracking. No compromise.

languages.a: German, Swiss German (with regional dialects), French, Italian, Romansh, and English to start. More languages coming soon.

dataStorage.a: Your data is not stored. Text is sent to Infomaniak servers in Switzerland where Apertus processes it and returns the translation. Nothing is saved.

free.a: This first version is free. A full-featured version may be released later if there's enough interest.

different.q: What makes Helvetra different from Google Translate or DeepL?
different.a: No tracking, and your data stays in Switzerland, not the US (Google) or the EU (DeepL). Plus a single-purpose focus on translation, no distractions.

swissGerman.q: Does Helvetra really understand Swiss German?
swissGerman.a: As much as Apertus allows, yes. Helvetra relies on Apertus for translations and cannot guarantee or be held accountable for results.

dataTraining.q: Is my data used to train AI models?
dataTraining.a: No. Helvetra does not use your data in any form.

apertus.a: Apertus is Switzerland's open-source AI language model, developed by ETH Zurich, EPFL, and CSCS. Trained on over 15 trillion tokens across 1,000+ languages, including Swiss German and Romansh. It's built for transparency and the public good. Helvetra is not affiliated with Apertus but chose to build on it because we believe in its mission. Learn more at Swiss AI, EPFL AI, and ETH AI.

infomaniak.a: Infomaniak is a Swiss company offering open-source AI infrastructure powered by 100% renewable energy. Your data stays in Switzerland, no queries are stored, and the energy used is recovered for heating. Helvetra is not affiliated with Infomaniak. We simply chose them because they align with our values. Learn more.

api.q: Is there an API for businesses?
api.a: Not yet, but it's on the roadmap. Contact us if you're interested.

contribute.a: Sure! Reach out. We'd love to hear from you.

newsletter.confirmed: You're in! Your subscription is now confirmed.
newsletter.title: Stay updated
newsletter.subtitle: Get notified about new features and improvements.
newsletter.privacy: Your email is only used to send our newsletter. Unsubscribe anytime.

register.title: Create account
register.passwordHint: At least 8 characters with letters and numbers
register.privacyNotice: By creating an account, you agree to our
register.checkEmailDescription: We sent a verification link to {email}. Click the link to verify your account.

errors.emailExists: An account with this email already exists
errors.validationError: Please check your input and try again
errors.rateLimited: Too many attempts. Please wait a moment.
errors.passwordTooShort: Password must be at least 8 characters
errors.generic: Something went wrong. Please try again.

verification.title: Email Verification
verification.successDescription: Your email has been verified. You now have full access to your account.
verification.errorDescription: This verification link is invalid or has expired. Please request a new verification email.
verification.banner: Please verify your email to secure your account.

subscription.title: Subscription
subscription.manageInfo: To manage your subscription, contact us at

feedback.consent: I agree to share this feedback to improve translations
feedback.modalDescription: Your feedback helps improve translations. We'll store your rating along with the translation text.

limits.weeklyLimitReached: You've reached the weekly limit for anonymous users.
limits.usageLimitReached: You've reached your usage limit for this period.

pricing.title: Pricing
pricing.subtitle: Choose the plan that's right for you. Upgrade anytime to unlock more features.

success.title: Welcome to Helvetra+!
success.description: Your subscription is now active. Thank you for supporting Swiss development!

cancel.title: Payment cancelled
cancel.description: No worries! Your payment was cancelled. You can try again anytime.

errors.TEXT_TOO_LONG: Text too long. This first version supports up to 1'000 characters. Need more? Let us know at gruezi{'@'}helvetra.ch
errors.RATE_LIMITED: You're translating fast! This first version has usage limits. Want unlimited access? Let us know at gruezi{'@'}helvetra.ch

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.text1: Helvetra exists for one reason: to give Switzerland a translation tool that respects Swiss values. Privacy, quality, and independence.
mission.text2: Your words deserve to stay in Switzerland. Not on servers in the US or EU. Not used to train foreign AI models. Just translated, privately, and forgotten.

technology.title: Swiss Technology
technology.text1: Helvetra is powered by Apertus, the Swiss AI language model developed by ETH Zurich and EPFL, two of the world's leading technical universities. This is Swiss research excellence, made accessible.
technology.text2: Our infrastructure runs on Infomaniak, Switzerland's leading independent cloud provider. 100% renewable energy, 100% Swiss data centers, zero data retention.

privacy.title: Privacy by Design
privacy.text1: We built Helvetra with one principle: your data is yours. Translations are processed and immediately discarded. We don't store what you write. We don't track how you use the app.
privacy.text2: The only exception: if you choose to give feedback, you explicitly consent to share that specific translation. Nothing happens without your permission.

independence.title: Independent & Transparent
independence.text1: Helvetra is an independent Swiss company. Revenue goes directly to maintaining and improving the service. No hidden commissions, no investor pressure, no data monetization.
independence.text2: We use Apertus and Infomaniak because they align with our values, not because we're affiliated. We pay standard fees like any customer. Our only obligation is to you.

vision.title: Built for Switzerland
vision.text1: Helvetra is a love letter to Swiss technology. We believe Switzerland can build world-class digital tools that reflect our national values.
vision.text2: Questions or feedback? We'd love to hear from you: gruezi{'@'}helvetra.ch

confirm.title: Almost there!
confirm.instruction: Please check your inbox and click the confirmation link to complete your subscription.

disclaimer.title: Disclaimer
disclaimer.text: Helvetra uses AI for translations. We do not guarantee the accuracy or completeness of translations. Use at your own discretion.

scope.title: Scope
scope.text: These Terms and Conditions govern the use of Helvetra's translation services. By using Helvetra, you agree to these terms.

service.title: Service Description
service.text: Helvetra provides AI-powered translation services between German, Swiss German, French, Italian, Romansh, and English. Translations are generated by Apertus, a Swiss AI model, and are provided as-is without guarantee of accuracy.

tiers.title: Service Tiers
tiers.intro: Helvetra offers the following service tiers:

anonymous.name: Anonymous
anonymous.desc: Up to 400 characters per translation, maximum 2,000 characters per week. No registration required.

free.name: Basic (Free)
free.desc: Up to 10,000 characters per month. Registration required.

plus.name: Helvetra+
plus.desc: Up to 500,000 characters per month. Paid subscription.

cancellation.title: Cancellation
cancellation.text: You may cancel your subscription at any time. Subscriptions are opt-in for renewal. After cancellation, you retain access until the end of your billing period.

refunds.title: Refunds
refunds.text: All payments are final. No refunds are provided for subscription fees.

data.title: Data Handling
data.text: Helvetra does not store your translations. Text is processed and discarded immediately. The only exception is when you submit feedback and explicitly agree to share the translation for quality improvement purposes.

liability.title: Limitation of Liability
liability.text: Helvetra is provided as-is. We are not liable for any damages arising from the use of our service, including but not limited to inaccurate translations. Users are responsible for verifying translation accuracy for critical use cases.

changes.title: Changes to Terms
changes.text: We may update these terms at any time. Continued use of Helvetra after changes constitutes acceptance of the new terms.

jurisdiction.title: Jurisdiction
jurisdiction.text: These terms are governed by Swiss law. Any disputes shall be resolved in the courts of Bern, Switzerland.

contact.title: Contact
contact.text: For questions about these terms, contact us at

intro.title: Your Privacy Matters
intro.text: Helvetra is committed to protecting your privacy. We collect minimal data and store everything in Switzerland.

collection.title: What We Collect
collection.text: We only collect data when you explicitly choose to give feedback:
collection.item2: The translated text (only with your consent)
collection.item3: Optional: dialect region and comments you provide

notCollected.title: What We Do NOT Collect
notCollected.text: We respect your privacy and do not collect:
notCollected.item1: Your translations (unless you give feedback with consent)

storage.title: Where Data Is Stored
storage.text: All data is stored exclusively in Switzerland on Swiss servers (Infomaniak). Your data never leaves Switzerland.

usage.title: How We Use Data
usage.text: Feedback data is used solely to improve translation quality. We do not sell, share, or use your data for advertising.

rights.title: Your Rights
rights.item1: Know what data we have about you

contact.title: Contact Us
contact.text: For privacy questions or data requests, contact us at

meta.title: Helvetra vs Google Translate: Which Is Right for You?
meta.description: An honest comparison of Helvetra and Google Translate. We break down privacy, features, pricing, and Swiss language support to help you choose the right translation tool.

google.title: Helvetra vs Google Translate
google.subtitle: Two free translation tools built on fundamentally different philosophies. Here's an honest look at where each one shines — and where it falls short.

intro.p1: If you've ever needed to translate something, you've probably used Google Translate. It's everywhere — built into Chrome, Android, and countless apps. It's free, it's fast, and it supports over 130 languages. For most people, it's the default choice.
intro.p2: Helvetra takes a different approach. Instead of trying to translate everything for everyone, we focus on doing one thing well: private, high-quality translation for Swiss languages. Neither tool is objectively "better" — it depends entirely on what you need. Let's break it down honestly.

googleWins.title: Where Google Translate Wins

coverage.title: Unmatched Language Coverage
coverage.p1: Google Translate supports 133 languages — from Afrikaans to Zulu, including many regional and endangered languages. If you need to translate Thai, Swahili, or Welsh, Google is essentially your only free option. Helvetra supports five languages (German, French, Italian, English, and Swiss German), which covers Switzerland well but won't help you on a trip to Tokyo.
coverage.p2: This isn't a weakness we're trying to fix. Helvetra is intentionally focused on Swiss languages because that's where we can add real value. If you regularly work with languages outside this scope, Google Translate is the practical choice.

free.title: Truly Unlimited and Free
free.p1: Google Translate has no character limits, no daily caps, and no premium tier you're being nudged toward. You can translate entire documents, websites, even real-time conversations — all without paying a cent or creating an account. This is possible because Google's business model doesn't rely on charging for translation; it relies on the data you provide while using the service.

ecosystem.title: Deep Ecosystem Integration
ecosystem.p1: Google Translate is woven into the fabric of the internet. Right-click any text in Chrome and translate it. Point your phone camera at a sign in a foreign language and see the translation overlaid in real-time. Have a conversation with someone who speaks a different language using the app's conversation mode. If you live in Google's ecosystem, the convenience is hard to beat.

googleWins.verdict: Bottom line: If you need to translate exotic languages, want unlimited free usage, or love the convenience of Google's ecosystem integration, Google Translate is genuinely excellent at what it does.

helvetraWins.title: Where Helvetra Wins

privacy.title: Privacy as a Foundation, Not a Feature
privacy.p1: This is the fundamental difference between us. Google Translate is a free service because you pay with your data. Your translations can be stored, analyzed, and used to train Google's AI models. For casual use — looking up a word, translating a menu — this is a fair trade for most people.
privacy.p2: But what about translating a confidential business email? A legal document? Personal medical information? A love letter? This is where Helvetra's approach matters. We don't store your translations. We don't use them for training. They're processed on Swiss servers by Swiss AI and immediately deleted. Swiss privacy law — which is stricter than GDPR — applies to everything we do.

swissAi.title: Built on Swiss AI Technology
swissAi.p1: Helvetra is powered by Apertus, the Swiss large language model developed by ETH Zürich, EPFL, and the Swiss National Supercomputing Centre. This isn't just a badge — it's a fundamentally different approach to AI. Apertus is open-source, research-driven, and built for transparency rather than profit extraction.
swissAi.p2: When you use Helvetra, you're supporting the Swiss technology ecosystem instead of feeding more data to Big Tech. Your translations help fund Swiss research and infrastructure, not advertising algorithms in California.

swissGerman.title: The Only Swiss German Translator
swissGerman.p1: Google Translate doesn't support Swiss German. Neither does DeepL, Microsoft Translator, or any other major translation service. Helvetra is currently the only tool that can translate to and from Swiss German, with support for regional dialects like Zürich, Bern, Basel, and more. The quality is still improving — Swiss German is genuinely hard — but we're the only ones working on it.

simplicity.title: Simplicity by Design
simplicity.p1: Helvetra does one thing: translate text. There's no account required for basic use, no ads, no dark patterns trying to upsell you, no features you'll never use cluttering the interface. Google Translate has grown increasingly complex over the years — conversation mode, camera translation, saved translations, starred phrases, integration with dozens of other services. If you just want to paste some text and get a translation, Helvetra gets out of your way.

helvetraWins.verdict: Bottom line: If you work primarily with Swiss languages, care about where your data goes, or simply want a clean translation tool without the complexity, Helvetra was built for you.

privacyTradeoff.title: The Privacy Trade-off (Honestly)
privacyTradeoff.intro: Let's be direct about what "free" means for each service. Google Translate is free because your usage data has value to Google — for improving their AI, for understanding language patterns, for building better products. Helvetra's free tier exists to let you try the service, with a paid tier for heavy users. Here's exactly what each service collects:

googleCollects.title: What Google collects
googleCollects.point1: Your translation history (stored in your Google account unless you turn this off)
googleCollects.point2: Translation data used to improve Google's machine learning models
googleCollects.point3: Subject to US law, including the CLOUD Act which allows government data requests

helvetraCollects.title: What Helvetra collects
helvetraCollects.point1: Nothing. Translations are processed and immediately deleted from our servers.
helvetraCollects.point2: The only exception: if you voluntarily submit feedback, we store that specific translation to improve quality.

privacyTradeoff.honestTruth: Here's the honest truth: if you don't care about privacy, Google's data collection will be completely invisible to you. The service works great. But if you're translating anything sensitive — business documents, legal text, personal correspondence — you should know where that data goes and who can access it.

chooseGoogle.title: Choose Google Translate if:
chooseGoogle.point1: You need languages beyond German, French, Italian, English, and Swiss German
chooseGoogle.point2: You translate casually and aren't concerned about data privacy
chooseGoogle.point3: You want camera translation, voice input, or conversation mode
chooseGoogle.point4: You're already invested in Google's ecosystem and value the integration

chooseHelvetra.title: Choose Helvetra if:
chooseHelvetra.point1: You work primarily with Swiss languages and want optimized quality
chooseHelvetra.point2: Privacy matters — for business, legal, or personal reasons
chooseHelvetra.point3: You need Swiss German translation (we're the only option)
chooseHelvetra.point4: You prefer a simple, focused tool over a feature-packed platform
chooseHelvetra.point5: You want to support Swiss technology instead of Big Tech

conclusion.title: The Bottom Line
conclusion.p1: Google Translate is an incredible tool. It's free, it's everywhere, and it handles 133 languages with impressive quality. For casual use and global language coverage, nothing beats it. We're not trying to compete with that.
conclusion.p2: Helvetra exists for a different purpose: to give Swiss users a translation tool that respects their privacy, supports their languages (including Swiss German), and keeps their data in Switzerland. If that matters to you, we built this for you.
conclusion.p3: The best translation tool is the one that fits your values and your needs. Now you have the information to choose.
conclusion.cta: Ready to try a translation tool that respects your privacy?
